title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Gold standard of Bluetooth speakers
author: bobby smith
content: The best bang for your buck Bluetooth speaker period. Sound quality is great, bass is good, and it’s super rugged and can hold up to drops, dropping in water or splashing, and even dirt and sand! The battery also lasts a long time and the speaker gets super loud, like this thing sounds better than my tvs built in speakers. My only complaints are that the eq isn’t super adjustable with only 3 levels for bass mids and treble. I wish there was at least a little loop or something built in to carry it too, and I wish the usb a port in the back was usb c. I also wish the usb c port was recessed with the other usb port and covered by the rubber flap so that sand or dirt wouldn’t get in it. Other than that, there’s really nothing else I could ask for in a speaker. If you’re looking for a Bluetooth speaker that’s super loud and high quality but still portable and pretty light I would definitely get the charge 5.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States October 9, 2023

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars I’m impressed
author: Dennis McElroy
content: I bought this with a singular purpose in mind. I needed a loud, great sounding Bluetooth speaker for the back seat of my 65 Mustang convertible. This speaker met all of my criteria with volume that punches through the wind noise and great clarity of sound. The hard case is fantastic. The JBL app also allowed me to tweak the EQ settings. Great bang for the buck.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States June 3, 2024

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars JBL doesn't disappoint
author: Chuck
content: I have several JBL speakers. I really like my Flip 6 but LOVE the charge 5. The Charge 5 has better sound especially for outdoors. Both speakers can be joined in party mode (not stereo) with a simple press of the party mode button. JBLs easily connect, and stay connected, to Bluetooth. I still might get another Flip 6 (for stereo) on Prime day.The included case is great protection for traveling. Fits speaker well and has separate compartment for USB cable. The battery is very long lasting. The sound is full with good bass. Buy this, you won't regret it.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States April 8, 2024

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Sound Investment!
author: Michael T. Barefoot
content: Easy speakers to setup and they sound great too!
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States August 19, 2024

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Juicy Bloated Lemonade
author: Deth
content: Look I couldn't think of a good title...This little thing is amazing. I have been using Flip 5s for a while. Individually, those are great. But PartyBoost just doesn't work properly. Pops and thuds. Sound dropping completely. I'm no audiophile, and I honestly can't tell all that much of a difference in sound quality between the Charge 5 and the Flip 5, but I can say that I listened to music all day long using the Charge 5 as the base speaker for PartyBoost and had 0 issues with all the headaches that the Flips have been giving me.Basically, if you like the Flip, this has a bigger battery, marginally better sound, better IPX rating, and can be used to charge your phone in an pinch. It also uses Bluetooth 5 instead of the Flip's Bluetooth 4.2, which is probably a good chunk of the reason PartyBoost works better.Still no aux in, which is a mild bummer, but not a deal breaker. (The only thing I 'need' aux in for is currently using my Boombox 2, which conveniently has one!) No voice chat, which is a complete non-issue for me, but seems to be a pain point for a lot of folks.The case is nice, but I don't see myself needing it all that much for travel. I saw multiple people complaining about the speaker not fitting while others had no issue. I am fairly certain it is entirely related to what orientation you put the speaker in the case. Put it in the right way and it zips up no issue!Note: The Charge 5 does NOT come with a wall wart. You still get a USB A to USB C connector to charge it with, but you'll need to use an existing wall wart you already own. (I have seen complaints about this as well. But I have like 7 of them plugged in and another 10 or so sitting around as spares.)
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States June 14, 2021

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Speaker good. Base good. Support bad.
author: Bruce J.
content: The party boost works good. But trying to go in the stereo mode is very time-consuming. My Charge 4 goes in the stereo very quickly. These Charge 5 is haphazard and confusing. I could get it in stereo mode but it would take me 3 to 4 minutes going back-and-forth and back-and-forth until it went in to stereo mode. I called Support and the gentleman knew less than me about it. When I told him my problem, he would repeat it back incorrectly. I explained the problem again and he repeated it back incorrectly. After the third time, he did repeat it back correctly, but then said he would be back which I assuming he was googling how to do it. After dealing him for about 10 minutes, I finally gave up and told him it would be great if the JBL support team knew a little bit about their products. I can get them in the stereo mode now, but it still takes several minutes for it to go into that mode Which is nothing like the charge 4. I’d probably give the sound a 4 and the support a 0 so I guess since it’s a speaker and the sound is most important and it basically almost does what I needed it to, (but it just takes a while) i’ll round it two or 3.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 18, 2024

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Believe the Hype: This is an Amazing Speaker
author: Kemp Honeycutt
content: Despite the high rankings and glowing reviews, I'm always skeptical about speakers, especially portable speakers, and especially Bluetooth speakers. I am so impressed with the JBL Charge 5. The battery life is as advertised - we've played it for 3 or 4 hours and barely saw a dip in the battery level. The unit is VERY solidly built, and while we haven't dropped it into the pool (yet) it does appear to be able to handle a lot of wetness.It was absurdly simple to set up, and we were playing music within 5 minutes of opening the box (the speaker held about 50% charge when it arrived). Highest marks, highly recommended!But above all, the speaker sounds fantastic. The low-end response is stunning, and mids and highs deliver with clarity. We're sold on this platform and will be ordering at least 3 more to fill our backyard and pool area with music.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States May 25, 2023

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars An incremental evolution of an already strong product
author: Andrew Newman
content: The JBL Charge 5 is one of those "what you see is what you get" types of things. This is a speaker you might choose to use at home but it's "purpose" is to bring to an event where people want to make some noise and no "noise making" appliances are present. It allows everyone with a smart phone to play their favorite artist or mix and is loud enough to fill a room. Neither the dynamic range (noticable roll off on the deep bass end and a tweeter that is harsh until it breaks in and still sounds better from a distance) nor the accuracy are anything to write home about but that's really not the point. The point is to have fun, make noise and enjoy yourself. This speaker gets it done.One note, the Charge 5 is a bit "kidney" shaped vs the Charge 4. The supplied case that you get (for free) fits the Charge 5 much better if you turn it upside down with the "foot" facing up. The case provides a spot for the charging cable and a (user supplied) charging block. The device is already pretty rugged so it doesn't really need additional protection. The handle is handy.

author: Ed
content: It does what it suppose to, but the play button has a malfunction. I can skip a song, but wont be able to pause or vice versa. I didn't notice til the 30 day return window has passed. Now I'm stuck with it and have to skip and pause through my connected device instead of being able to simply push the button. This is a feature I use all the time on my JBL clip so it's an inconvenience to me.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States June 23, 2023

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love my JBL speaker!

content: The JBL charge 5 wireless speaker gives the best sound quality, with a balanced bass and upper tones too. The convenience of having a speaker anywhere I go. Highly recommend this speaker.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Charge 5 is worth it, case not so much.
author: Ryan C.
content: JBL Charge 5 is amazing, with robust sound and durable material. The case, on the other hand, provides zero interior or exterior padding. It is just a thin hard shell that barely fits the Charge 5. Since it was the same price as the base Charge 5, I bought this one with the case, but I would not recommend buying this just because it comes with a nifty looking case. The case is a $5 value addition, at most. And if you want to really protect your device you will likely end up buying a better quality case than this one.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States May 15, 2021

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice

content: Got it for $50.00 less than buying it at Best Buy. Also I got a nice case to go with it. You won't that when you buy it at Best Buy. Speedy delivery and Brand New for a $100.00. Great deal!

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars The battery dies rather quickly and there are sound issues.
author: Mitko
content: I always use it on low volume. The battery last for 10 hours or less. It feels like the battery drains at the same rate regardless if you are listening loud or quiet.Additionally, it does not sound good when connected to my Mac, it sounds better when connected to my PC or iPhone. Sometimes it interrupts the sound for a fraction of a second every few seconds when connected to my MacBook Pro.It does not accept sound through the USB-C port, it does not have AUX input, and does not have a microphone. The only way to connect it to anything is through Bluetooth.Overall it does what I bought it for, but not very well and nothing more.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2022
